main event: A silvery-white object with protruding structure was observed for approximately three hours in Big Spring, Texas on July 11, 1955.
interesting points: The object followed a straight and vertical path for the duration of the sighting.
Observers noted structure protruding from the object, indicating a possible organized shape.
The report suggests that the sighting could likely be explained by a balloon, based on the object's description, duration of the sighting, and wind conditions.
The sighting was categorized as a Ground-Visual and Air-Visual observation, indicating multiple perspectives.
The report includes an attached AF Form 112 on this sighting, adding further detail and credibility to the report.
result: prosaic explanation (probably caused by a balloon)
